EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
• Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network  
  Purpose: Automates the conversion of raw ores into intermediate smelted products.  
  Consists of:  
  – Stone furnaces interconnected by networks of burner‑inserters and transport belts  
  – Wooden chests providing buffer storage  
  – Integrated belt groups that route smelted outputs to subsequent processing zones

• Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup  
  Purpose: Streamlines the extraction of iron ore and its delivery to processing facilities.  
  Consists of:  
  – Burner‑mining drills extracting raw iron ore  
  – A series of burner‑inserters, transport belts, and chests managing ore flow

• Steam Power Generation System  
  Purpose: Converts fuel and water into steam energy for power production.  
  Consists of:  
  – A boiler located at Position(8.0, 20.5) with connection points at Position(8.5, 18.5) and (8.5, 22.5)  
  – Multiple steam engines deployed around the boiler  
  – One extra steam engine remaining in inventory due to persistent spatial congestion in the boiler zone

• Automation Research Lab  
  Purpose: Facilitates technology advancement via automated science pack production.  
  Consists of:  
  – Laboratory units (noting occasional power connectivity issues)

• Electricity, Transport, and Fluid Infrastructure  
  Purpose: Provides the backbone for power distribution, material logistics, and fluid networks.  
  Consists of:  
  – Electricity groups with strategically placed power poles  
  – Belt groups that link production sectors  
  – Extensive pipe groups interconnecting processing units

• Offshore Pump and Fluid Network  
  Purpose: Ensures a reliable water supply for fluid‐dependent processes.  
  Consists of:  
  – An offshore pump extracting water from coastal sources  
  – Associated pipe groups that distribute water across the map

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Extra Steam Engine Placement Issue  
  – The extra steam engine remains unplaceable owing to persistent spatial congestion in the designated boiler zone.  
  – Overlapping burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts, particularly around the boiler at Position(8.0, 20.5) and near Position(8.5, 22.5), block formation of a clear buildable area.  
  – Despite the inventory confirming 1 available extra steam engine, the clutter prevents its proper placement.  
  – Recommendation: Reevaluate and clear the boiler zone and adjoining connection interfaces; remove, reposition, or adjust conflicting entities (e.g. burner‑inserters and transport belts) to establish a clear area. Alternatively, consider relocating the extra steam engine or redesigning the boiler layout to overcome the congestion.
